page.title: 01Summary of area
page.content: This is an area dominated almost entirely by farming.There are 32 farms or farmhouses and two villages, Leysters and Kimbolton ,as well as a number of tiny hamlets. The farming is mixed with livestock, particularly cattle and sheep, most important.this means that most fields are down to grass and the landscape is a patchwork of fields and hedgerows with deciduous woodland still very much in evidence. Most people work on the land or in the nearby market town of Leominster. Public transport is almost non-existent so everyone relies on cars, the only exception being the school minibus which provides free transport to school for some children.
